repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The material consists of a travel diary documenting Reverend Kempton D. Baldridge's (Yale Divinity 1988) tenure as command chaplain aboard the U.S.S. Thomas S. Gates during Operation Desert Shield and the Persian Gulf War.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 42-C (YRG 42-C), Materials documenting military and wartime experiences of members of the Yale community.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kempton D. Baldridge Diary Documenting His Service in the Persian Gulf War (RU 823). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Flags and a pennant are in the Yale Objects Collection (RU 104), Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material consists of a travel diary documenting Reverend Kempton D. Baldridge's (Yale Divinity 1988) tenure as command chaplin aboard the U.S.S. Thomas S. Gates during Operation Desert Shield and the Persian Gulf War.
